head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #28

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #28 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Remarks and occurrences on board the Schooner Nancy Hired Transport on her return passage to Makinac or St Josephs in the month of October 1813[.]
At 8 PM set the watch at 10 wind ENE with rain, very dark & cold disagreeable weather[.]

At day light got under weigh for Makinac, single reefed the main sail & main top sail, rain & cold, wind N by E at 7 AM course W by S clear of the detour, at ½ past 10 close in with Bois blanc Island, got both anchors ready, thick rainy weather & blowing very fresh from the NW & NNW impossible to clear the land, obliged to come too in 2½ fathom water with both anchors, before we could the main sail in it blows to pieces – handed the sails, at 11 the weather clears up more, see Makinac distant about 4 miles – at noon wind WNW at 2 PM West some people appear on the shore, hoisted the Jack, they go off again at 4 a heavy squall, from the Westward at 6 more moderate set a double anchor watch – at 8 the weather becomes more clear[.]
afternoon of this day one hand employed mending another M: sail

At day light, bent the other main sail & hove up the small bower, at 8 the best bower made sail wind WNW & clear cold weather beating up for Makinac at 1 PM came too in 3 fathom water & about 3 cable lengths from the shore handed all sails – latter part of the day squally from the NW & clear weather – (at 8 PM set the watch – a heavy fall of snow & frost[.]
All this day blows fresh from the WNW & squally with snow, discharged a few packages […] – & all the gun power[.]

Squalls of snow at intervals fore part of this day wind at NW discharged some part of the ordinance & merchandise – latter part the weather becomes more settled, but cold & freezing hard, dryed the square sail & old main sail – a number of canoes arrive from Montreal at 8 PM set the watch[.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
